text: Bribing the Scholars
Not all Cathayans are loyal ministers and valiant generals. If your rewards are rich enough, scholars will gladly debate in your favor.
Reclaiming Wei-Jin
You have reclaimed Wei-Jin from the hands of foreign invaders!
Appeasement and Defense
The troubles within your lands have left you unable to launch an immediate campaign to retake Wei-Jin.
Other Cathayan factions declare war on the occupiers.
All factions loyal to the Dragon Emperor will unite to declare war on the foreign invaders who have seized Wei-Jin.
While you hold Wei-Jin, you cannot negotiate peace with Cathayan factions.
You will face the might of Cathayan forces on the battlefield.
Before Wei-Jin is reclaimed, the march of Cathay’s fury will never cease!
At long last, Wei-Jin has returned to the embrace of Cathay through your efforts. Today, your name will be etched into history as a hero who shook the ages!
Other Cathayan factions have reclaimed Wei-Jin from foreign invaders.
Wei-Jin has been captured by another foreign faction, allowing Cathay to make peace with the original occupiers.
Bring the Attack
Bribe the Scholars
Forcefully declare war on Cathayan factions. While holding Wei-Jin, no peace is possible.
Foster goodwill with Cathay.

Wei-Jin, the crown jewel of the Celestial Empire, the site of the Five Elements Compass, and the Dragon Emperor’s earthly palace, is now under our control. However, the backlash from Cathayans will be fierce and unrelenting...
Seizing Wei-Jin
Join the Battle
Appeasement and Defense
Before Wei-Jin is reclaimed, Cathay’s fury will never cease!
Wei-Jin? What does that have to do with me?

Wei-Jin, the crown jewel of the Celestial Empire, the site of the Five Elements Compass, and the Dragon Emperor’s earthly palace, has fallen to foreign invaders. This is a disgrace to all of Cathay! Messengers from the Shen Ce Fu have been dispatched across the land, and princes and nobles from all provinces are prepared for battle. Armies from across the land are gathering to march on the capital.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]Those not of our kind who occupy Wei Jing must be opposed by all under heaven![[/col]]
Fall of Wei-Jin
Wei-Jin Falls
Wei-Jin Changes Hands
Wei-Jin Reclaimed
Wei-Jin Reclaimed
Stabilizing the Crisis
Shame of Cathay
Wei-Jin has been captured by foreign factions.
Wei-Jin has changed hands between foreign factions while Cathay stands helpless. This will forever be a stain on our history...
Urgent news from the front! A coalition force has successfully reclaimed Wei-Jin, returning the capital to Cathay’s embrace!

Your forces breach the damaged gates, and the streets are deserted. Once a shining jewel, the city has been ravaged by the invaders. Doors creak open, and more citizens step cautiously onto the streets, gazing in disbelief at your troops. Many did not survive to see the capital reclaimed, but your arrival has brought hope to those who remain. A cheer breaks out, then another. Soon, the streets erupt in joyous tears and cries of relief.
You will join other Cathayan factions in declaring war on those who seized Wei-Jin. No peace is possible until the capital is reclaimed.
Cathayan factions have declared war on you, vowing to cleanse the shame of Wei-Jin with your blood.
Unite Against the Invaders
Cathay will cleanse the shame of Wei-Jin with the blood of the invaders!
[[col:red]]Panic and Unrest (Turns 1-8 after the Capital Falls)[[/col]]
Wei-Jin is more than a capital to Cathayans—it is a symbol of their connection to the immortal and mysterious Celestial Court. News of its fall fills every heart with fear and fury.
[[col:red]]Chaos Ensues (Turns 8-16 after the Capital Falls)[[/col]]

Wei-Jin remains in foreign hands, and bickering generals blame one another for the loss. Plans to reclaim the capital are nearly abandoned. Though Cathay’s forces still watch the occupiers closely, ambitious lords have begun plotting their own schemes as the heart of the empire crumbles...
[[col:red]]Collapse of the Celestial Empire (16+ Turns after the Capital Falls)[[/col]]

Cathayan forces have lost the will to reclaim the capital. Self-serving lords openly seize one another’s territories, leaving the homeless populace to wander. The empire teeters on the brink of collapse. Is there no one who can rally the people and reverse this dire situation?
Clash of Wills

Mistrust between Yun Xiang and Yuan Bo has grown uncontrollable. The Shen Ce Fu army bypasses the Jade Court to attack foreign enemies, while the Jade Court’s Raven Spies openly investigate the Garrison Bureau’s offices. Though the two leaders maintain a façade of cooperation, as factions choose sides, internal strife within Cathay is bound to intensify.
We should support the Dragon’s children.
The legacy of Cathay rests on their shoulders. Yuan Bo will be pleased to see his allies still trust him.
Perhaps Yun Xiang is more dependable.
Yun Xiang has addressed problems that the aloof Dragon’s children have overlooked and values cooperation with Cathay’s loyal champions.
Try to mediate.
With enemies at the gates, Cathay cannot afford internal conflict. Your influence could mend this rift. Call for a meeting to resolve this crisis.
Perhaps we should wait and see.
A previous rebellion caused by interference is still fresh in memory. Now is not the time to act—the leaders will find their balance.
Diplomatic Relations: %+n with Celestial Loyalists.
Diplomatic Relations: %+n with the Jade Court.
Triggers follow-up events.
Council of Dragons and Men

You have successfully convinced Yun Xiang and Yuan Bo to attend the meeting, but the atmosphere is tense. The Dragon Emperor’s Imperial Guard and the Jade Court Sentinels glare at each other. Yun Xiang’s disdain for the Jade Dragon is evident, while Yuan Bo dismisses Yun Xiang as a mere mortal. You need a unifying topic to align their goals.
Urge them to focus on the people of Cathay.
Despite their differences, they share a common goal: to protect Cathay. This may unite them.
Remind them of Cathay’s enemies.
Cathay teeters on the brink of destruction. Internal strife will be its undoing.
Point out the internal blockades and espionage.
The Raven Spies and Hongwu Inspectors waste their resources fighting each other instead of the enemy. This rivalry must end.
Seal the hall and spark a rebellion.
Everyone is stunned—no one expected such betrayal at this meeting. You have united Cathay’s factions, but now they stand united against you.
You supported the Jade Court, and they will repay you.
Gift from the Jade Court
The Shen Ce Fu controls Cathay’s military strategy and will reward those who aid them.
Support from the Shen Ce Fu
The people are the foundation of Cathay. Even the Dragon’s children and the Dragon God’s champions must not ignore them, lest they fade into history’s oblivion.
Peace and Prosperity
Cathay faces its greatest peril yet. We must set aside our differences and unite against the enemy.
Prepare for War
The Raven Spies and Hongwu Inspectors must be directed to serve Cathay’s needs rather than obstructing each other.
Seamless Strategy
All of Cathay will oppose us, but there is no turning back. Civil war is here.
The Great Rebellion
You will gain significant bonuses for 15 turns, but all of Cathay will turn against you.
Arrival of the Haotian Envoy

Thunderous roars shake your camp. An unexpected visitor stuns your soldiers: a member of the Dragon Emperor’s Imperial Guard. They last left the capital during a time of rebellion, crushing disobedient generals like ants. Now, with one of Haotian’s blades in your camp, your troops are filled with uncontrollable dread.
Respectfully inquire about the envoy’s purpose.
The Imperial Guard represents Haotian’s will. We should tread carefully.
Display your authority.
You are a pillar of Cathay. This is your domain, and no one but the Dragon Emperor himself can make you bow.
The envoy silently hands you a sword—not as an execution order, but as a gift from the Dragon Emperor.

The envoy’s momentary surprise is clear. They are reassured by your resolve—this was, after all, their purpose in visiting. Without such composure, most Imperial Guards would have taken the offender’s head back to the capital. Now, the envoy will follow your lead and witness your campaign.
The State of Cathay

Your advisors are at odds. Your contributions to Cathay far surpass those of the imperial nobility. The Dragon Emperor has been absent for over a century, and the fractured provinces cannot withstand the rising chaos. Some generals argue that Cathay must unify under your leadership to break free from the shackles of destruction. Others insist on adhering to tradition: the provinces governed by the Dragon’s children, preserving the Dragon Emperor’s legacy, and protecting the people. To seize the provinces would risk overstepping your bounds...
Support the idea of unifying the provinces.
The division of Cathay by the Dragon’s children weakens it. A united Cathay under my banner will be stronger.
Adhere to the provincial governance system.
The Dragon’s children govern according to local needs, countering threats as they arise. To unify the provinces would be counterproductive.
Cathay’s factions will soon learn of your decision.
The division of Cathay by the Dragon’s children weakens it. A united Cathay under my banner will be stronger.
Dominion of the Six Directions
The Dragon’s children govern according to local needs, countering threats as they arise. To unify the provinces would be counterproductive.
Duties Divided
A Knife in the Shadows

One of your trusted officers wakes you in the dead of night, accompanied by guards—they have captured a Hongwu Inspector.\\n\\nUnlike the emotionless and loyal Jade Ravens, some Hongwu Inspectors lack resolve and have been bribed to betray the Dragon Emperor. The traitor kneeling before you had been plotting your assassination, and if not for your loyal troops, the consequences would have been dire.
Execute Him
Traitors who abandon loyalty deserve death at the hands of the righteous.
Hand Him Over
Let his peers handle their own affairs.
Others will think twice before betraying you after seeing this traitor’s fate.
Tightened Security
With his network unclear, leaving this matter to others complicates future control, as he is no longer under your watch.
Slipped Through the Net
Though the plan failed, I escaped alive. Next time, the target won’t be so lucky...
Spy Games
Recruit the Mole
Those driven by greed can be made to serve anyone.
Diplomatic Relations: %+n with the Rebel Lords of Nan Yang.
Diplomatic Relations: %+n with the Dissenter Lords of Jinshen.
Heavenly Khagan

During Cathay’s third grand expedition into the Chaos Wastes, numerous tribes once enslaved by Chaos joined the war, rallying under Cathay’s banner. Their liberation was sealed by Yi Qing at Bloodwind Keep. As Cathay’s ties with the southern steppes deepened, some tribes decided to integrate into Cathay to resist Chaos. They bestowed upon Cathay’s ruler the title of "Heavenly Khagan." However, these nomads, unaware of the Dragon Emperor’s existence, now tremble before you, mistaking you for the Heavenly Khagan.
Accept the Title
Just as the Jade Dragon became known as the Dragon Emperor in the West, a misunderstanding by these nomads is understandable.
Dedicate the Title to the Dragon Emperor
Cathay’s glory is the Dragon Emperor’s glory. Such honors are not ours to claim.
Cathay is never short of praise, yet every word of it is uplifting.
Honor of the Celestial Empire
Your northern allies see you as their true leader, but one can only imagine the reaction of other Cathayan nobles upon hearing your new title...
Loyalty of the Nomads
Dragon Emperor’s Imperial Guard
Traveling with a member of the Dragon Emperor’s Imperial Guard is always an enlightening experience.
Haotian Blade
A blessed blade passed down for centuries in Cathay, bearing the weight of the nation and regarded as a symbol of the Dragon Emperor’s favor.
Stranger in Strange Lands

As your army crosses the great river, a sharp-eyed soldier spots a woman clinging to a plank, drifting downstream. Her golden hair stands out starkly. Your soldiers attempt to rescue her, but the raging current makes it nearly impossible to get close.
Attempt the Rescue
Use the Celestial Winds to aid in the rescue. We cannot abandon her.
Abandon the Effort
The soldiers have done their best, but we’ve spent too much time. Let us hope another will come to her aid as we move on.
Princess of Saphery
Thank you, my lord. Without your aid, I would have perished like the rest of my envoy. I will send word to my homeland, but until I return to Ulthuan, please allow me to repay your kindness.
Storyteller
To know what happens next, stay tuned for the next episode...
The Storyteller

Your army enters a bustling city where locals speak of an extraordinary storyteller in a teahouse. This masked figure is always accompanied by a group of small rats. Some suspect he is one of the creatures from the ruins of the Warpstone Desert, while others whisper he is a Monkeyman from the Celestial Mountains.\\n\\nIntrigued, you head to the teahouse only to see a group of Jade Warriors escorting the storyteller away. Suspicious individuals have reported him to the authorities.
Rescue Him
Though cloaked and masked, his imposing stature is undeniable. If he joins our cause, great things are within reach!
Ignore It
You hear him recite, "Like a drifter on the tide, ask not where I wander." \\n\\nDespite his capture, he remains calm and composed. Perhaps fate will bring your paths together again.
Your soldiers have exerted all their strength to defy nature’s forces. Though successful, they will need time to recover.
[[col:red]]Exhausted Soldiers[[/col]]
Tales of this enigmatic storyteller grow increasingly wild. Wherever you go, expect intrigue and curiosity to follow.
[[col:red]]Curious Company[[/col]]
Tenets of Military Reform

Authored by "Queller of Chaos" Yi Qing, the *Tenets of Military Reform* detail his strategies for restructuring the army. He advocates for a permanent heavy cavalry force stationed along the Great Bastion, using formation charges to counter the guerrilla tactics of Chaos marauders employing light cavalry against infantry lines. Based on this, he devised an extensive system of reforms.\\n\\nThis strategy has proven highly effective in battles at the Great Bastion, yet debate continues over whether it should be implemented on a broader scale.
Implement Reform
As warfare evolves, we must learn from frontline experiences to remain undefeated.
Maintain Status Quo
Our Celestial armies are invincible under heaven—what does this upstart know of leading armies into battle?
Your army will require time to adapt to these reforms, while entrenched interests may resist your changes.
[[col:red]]Resistance to Reform[[/col]]
The Duty of All

Your army marches through peaceful countryside, untouched by war. The tranquil atmosphere is almost disorienting, and many of your soldiers hail from villages like this—most are gone now. Your reverie is broken by your lieutenant, who reports a group of young villagers trailing the army. Despite being urged to return home, they insist on following the famed general to the battlefield, hoping to earn their place in history.
Recruit Them
The fate of the Celestial Empire is the duty of all. We cannot dampen their fervor. With luck, they may indeed be remembered beyond the fields of the fallen.
Send Them Back
This is nonsense! A rabble of inexperienced youths following my army? Send them home at once.
The spurned youths will spread word of your refusal, tarnishing your reputation. Yet you cannot stand by and watch them perish—the people are the future of Cathay.
Image Shattered
Your reputation draws people to your cause. Though you understand the grim fate that awaits most, you also know that every sacrifice brings Cathay closer to victory in its darkest hour.
Many Rushing to Join
Improper Promotions

During an inspection of newly promoted officers, you find them to be exemplary Jade Warriors. As you prepare to leave, a group of soldiers bursts in, demanding an audience. Waving a document, they angrily accuse one officer of bribing his way to promotion. The accused turns pale—it seems he indeed resorted to dishonorable means. Yet your inspection reveals him to be an exceptional talent. You ponder why someone so capable felt compelled to bribe his way forward, but the soldiers grow increasingly agitated. A decision must be made swiftly.
Uphold Promotion
His misconduct will be dealt with separately, but talent like his cannot be wasted.
Enforce Justice
We cannot allow such injustice. Both the briber and the official who accepted the bribe will be thoroughly investigated.
Allowing this behavior will not go unnoticed by others...
Fostering Corruption
The righteous will be rewarded, and the dishonorable will find no refuge.
Strict Discipline
Characters may sustain injuries.
Your bold decision is bound to attract dissent.
Uneasy Advisors
A nomadic army will gather at the Great Bastion, pledging loyalty to you.
Right Wise King Wuda Ruodi
Perform Your Duty
The Great Bastion shields all Cathayans—it is our duty to ensure its strength.
Contribute Generously
You offer generous contributions to bolster the Great Bastion, ensuring more reinforcements.
Above the Great Bastion
For countless generations, Cathay has thrived under the protection of the Great Bastion. To maintain its immense defenses, the imperial nobility regularly contributes substantial donations.
Provide Full Support
With such overwhelming support, the Celestial Empire’s elite forces can march to the frontlines.
A peasant militia will support the Great Bastion.
A regiment of Jade Warriors will reinforce the Great Bastion.
A force of Celestial Dragon Guards will reinforce the Great Bastion.
[[col:red]]Your soldiers will not be pleased...[[/col]]
Line Your Pockets
Cathay’s wealth is vast, with countless factions supporting the Great Bastion. Surely my share won’t be missed...
You chose self-preservation over the greater good. While this benefits you in the short term, others in Cathay will not see it that way.
[[col:red]]"Abandoning the Nation—How Can Such a Wretch Achieve Greatness?"[[/col]]
Battle of Weijin

Amidst fire and ashes, light pierces the darkness. The rebellion of the King of Nan Yang heralds chaos across Cathay. Once a celebrated general who crushed countless uprisings for the Dragon Emperor, he now leads an army to topple the eternal dynasty. Former comrades turn against one another, brothers-in-arms now bitter enemies. Half of the northern provinces have pledged themselves to his cause, vowing to overthrow the celestial reign.\\n\\nThe Celestial Strategists’ generals rallied to counter the rebellion, dispatching three great armies. Yet, each was decisively defeated: General Tianxian fell at the Grave Plains under a storm of arrows from the "Duke of Xuanhuan"; General Mingjing was lured into a trap by the "Marquis of Jingji," meeting his end at a banquet; and General Hubu, despite his battlefield prowess, was impaled by the "Marquis of Wuqiu." The Celestial court stands paralyzed by fear and confusion, for the King of Nan Yang seems to foresee every strategy, aiming to annihilate the Dragon Emperor’s forces.\\n\\nAmidst this turmoil, only the Dragon Emperor’s Champion remains composed. His decision is clear: the Imperial Guard shall march from the capital to annihilate the rebel coalition near the Jewel City. As it was a century ago, no one will threaten the capital while he stands.
Salvage the Empire
Cloudwalker, Cathay’s most skilled general, has taken command of the Imperial Guard. The tide of war may yet change...
Like Leaves in the Wind
Han Cheng’s reputation as the "War Saint" is well-earned. With the northern lords rallying to his banner, Weijin may fall...
The future is uncertain...
[[col:red]]The future is uncertain...[[/col]]

My lord, news from Weijin! "Heavenly Mandate" has achieved a great victory, slaying three of Han Cheng’s trusted allies and scattering the rebel coalition. The King of Nan Yang has fled back to Ruimei!\\n\\nIt is said that on the cliffs, Cloudwalker held firm, leading the Imperial Guard against a coalition several times their size. Though the flanks faltered under relentless assault, Han Cheng’s attempt to encircle Cloudwalker ended in chaos when Longma riders descended upon his ranks, scattering his troops. Though triumphant, the cost was heavy—yet Han Cheng’s defeat in this battle may spell the end of his rebellion.
The wheels turn ever forward...
Securing the Empire

My lord, news from Weijin! "Heavenly Mandate’s" gamble has failed. The elite forces of Weijin are all but annihilated, and Han Cheng’s armies march on the capital...\\n\\nThe battle was fierce, with the Imperial Guard and rebel forces locked in a deadly stalemate. Yet betrayal came from within, as "Duke Zhuxiang" turned his forces against the Celestial Army, striking from the rear. The tides turned irreversibly, and Cloudwalker’s blade fell in resignation as his soldiers broke and fled. The capital now lies exposed to Han Cheng’s advancing army.
The wheels turn ever forward...
Securing the Empire
Shattered Harmony

My lord, negotiations between the Celestial Strategists and the Jade Court have collapsed. Yuan Bo has declared Cloudwalker a traitor to the Empire, calling upon the Dragon Sons to drive him out of the capital. Most generals of the Strategists remain loyal to their Celestial Warlord, but the situation grows perilously close to full-scale war...
The future is unclear...
The Empire cannot endure another civil war...
Support the Celestial Strategists
Yuan Bo’s cold pragmatism reduces all to mere pawns. We must challenge him on the battlefield to force his concession.
Side with the Jade Court
Yuan Bo, as the Dragon Emperor’s son and Cathay’s greatest unifier, must be supported—even against Cloudwalker’s defiance.
End the Strife
Amid the chaos, you alone hold the power to expose the true enemy behind this conflict and bring peace before war engulfs all.
Civil War

My lord, envoys from the Strategists and Jade Court have sought an audience. Yuan Bo’s initial attack on Weijin failed, and news of Cloudwalker’s rebellion against the Dragon Sons has unsettled the people. We must carefully decide our course of action.
Form an alliance with the Celestial Loyalists to strike down Yuan Bo and force his compromise.
Form an alliance with the Jade Court. Cloudwalker’s hubris must be checked before it tears the Empire apart.
Deploy your spies to uncover the truth behind this conflict. With evidence in hand, you can expose the true instigator and halt the war.
Though the people may never know, you averted a disaster that could have consumed all of Cathay.
Peacemaker
You have chosen his destiny.
Fate’s Chosen
Rising of Hedong

The people of Hedong have risen in rebellion under "Jade Moonlight" Zhao Qi, turning the tide of the war against the Dark Elf invaders.\\n\\nCathay’s eastern coastline has suffered greatly under the raids of foreign invaders. Despite the efforts of the Sea Dragon’s fleets to intercept them, these fragmented raiders have evaded blockades to burn undefended villages, enslaving countless citizens. Zhao Qi’s Moonlight Sect has worked tirelessly to rescue displaced citizens, and as more join their cause, they now possess the strength to directly combat the Dark Elves.
Called by the People
Crossing States and Counties

With the Dragon Sons returning to quell rebellion, the insurgents across counties have been eradicated—except for the King of Nan Yang and the usurper, who continue their desperate resistance. Intelligence suggests they are rallying remaining forces for a final, all-out counterattack!
Let them come
Peasant uprisings will erupt across Hedong’s provinces.
Muster your forces and prepare for the rebels’ final assault.
Your righteous actions have garnered widespread support. Your supply consumption will decrease!
Supply Line Support
Battle of Chaos Wasteland

After the Third Northern Expedition, the Chaos tribes retreated deep into the Wasteland. The border armies, stretched thin, prepared to cease pursuit when the Khan launched raids, leaving the northern granaries empty and the people exhausted.\\n\\nThus, Grand Overseer Yuan Bo dispatched Generals Yi Qing and Huo Su to lead two elite armies into the Wasteland, seeking to annihilate the Chaos tribes and lay siege to Bloodwind Keep. A climactic battle is about to begin, echoing across the desolate steppes.
Devour the Land
Cathay’s iron cavalry has crushed the enemy time and time again. The scattered Chaos tribes are no match for them.
Retreat in Panic
Deep in the Wasteland, uncertainty reigns. The Khan’s forces may be lying in wait, ready to strike.

My lord, news from the Great Bastion! Yi Qing’s forces encountered the Khan in the desert, delivering a crushing blow, killing tens of thousands, and forcing his remnants to retreat to Bloodwind Keep.
South of the Wastes, No Khagan...
Sealing the Wolves

My lord, news from the Great Bastion reports that Yi Qing's forces have been locked in combat with the Khan for days, unable to break the stalemate. Chaos reinforcements pour in relentlessly, overwhelming the defenses. Meanwhile, Huo Su's forces have gone astray in the northern wastes, unable to join the battle, leaving Yi Qing unsupported. He has retreated south of Longkui Road, and the iron cavalry is nearly wiped out. The Khan may invade at any moment...
Heroes Wrapped in Shrouds...
Broken Spear, Sinking Sands
Zhu Xiang Lord Xun Chun
General of Rapid Cavalry Huo Su
Flickering Candlelight

The candlelights on the dense forests flicker as the Candle Guards seek aid from the provinces. The power of Chaos sweeps over the mountains, with Nurgle’s vanguard spreading plague and disease that have worn down the soldiers. The Twenty-Eight Star Generals have all been deployed to the front lines. The southern gods of the gates attempt to hold off the invasion beneath the Candle Tower, but their weakened bodies struggle against the spreading corruption. My lord, evil lurks within the forests, and the storm is imminent.
Light the Night

[[col:red]]The invasion has begun. "Duke Jingnan" Duan Wei and the Candle Guards will defend the land at Ashia Candle Tower with their lives.[[/col]]\\n\\nYou will participate in a near-hopeless battle as one of the Twenty-Eight Star Generals.
Ogre Diplomacy

Since the Ogre Wars, Cathay’s relationship with the giant denizens of the Mountains of Mourn has been tenuous. Cathay occasionally hires ogre mercenaries for both caravans and armies, but instances of caravans and citizens being devoured persist. Among the Dragon Lords, only the Eighth Lord of Shanyang maintains a close relationship with the ogres, reportedly sharing personal ties with the tyrant Greasus Goldtooth. He seems inclined to set aside old grievances and forge a new alliance, though his erratic nature leaves his intentions unpredictable.
Let’s hope it goes smoothly
Cathay has always valued peace, and the ogres hold key positions along the western trade routes. Turning them into allies could greatly enhance trade and commerce.
It might end in a fight

The barbarians of the Mountains of Mourn have always been at odds with Cathay. Though the Goldtooth Tyrant is friendly with the Eighth Lord, his underlings are unruly. Let them clash, and may the ogres learn to fear us.

My lord, news from Shanyang reports that the Eighth Lord and Goldtooth Tyrant have sworn an oath of eternal friendship. Shanyang will supply the ogres with Cathay’s culinary delicacies in exchange for their warriors guarding the western trade routes. If nothing else, the roads westward will now be much safer.
Cathay gains a new ally
Silk Road Alliance

My lord, news from Shanyang reports a dire incident. Goldtooth’s subordinates insulted Cathay’s Jade Warriors during a banquet, leading to a deadly altercation. One of the Goldtooth ogres tore a Jade Warrior in half on the spot, spilling blood throughout the embassy’s banquet hall. Though the Eighth Lord managed to send the Goldtooth delegation away unharmed, the outraged Cathayan officials demand retribution. A conflict seems unavoidable...
It was bound to happen...
Conflict has erupted between Cathay and the ogres.
Bloody Banquet
The cooperation of ogre laborers has significantly improved trade efficiency along the Silk Road.
Silk Road Alliance
United Against Chaos
It’s time to direct our blades at Cathay’s true enemies!
Behind the Curtain

The Deceiver’s plot has been uncovered! The civil war has been thwarted before it could begin, and Yuan Bo and Yun Xiang have reconciled. Changeling has fled Cathay, and now it’s time to face the true enemies of the Celestial Empire.
Yuan Bo and Yun Xiang will form an alliance with you to declare war against the Deceiver.
Battle of Longmen Gate

The Great Bastion burns. Chaos Dwarfs’ siege engines shatter the ancient walls as the soldiers fall amidst the chaos. Zhatan the Blackheart’s sudden assault has devastated the Border Armies. Messengers from the provinces have been sent seeking reinforcements. My lord, we have tended to an exhausted messenger, and word from other courts suggests the provinces are preparing reinforcements for a decisive strike at Longmen Gate to destroy the Chaos Dwarfs’ siege engines. It is time to decide.
Join the Battle
A regiment stands ready, awaiting your orders to march to the Great Bastion for the assault.
Decline Assistance
Our forces are already stretched too thin. Sending reinforcements is not feasible at this time.

[[col:red]]Zhatan the Blackheart has declared war on Cathay.[[/col]]\\n\\nA new regiment will be sent to the Great Bastion to join the assault against the Chaos Dwarfs. Victory will grant you command of this regiment.
Be the wall that protects the land.
Guardian of the Celestial Empire
Battle of the Jade Delta

The Hedong uprising gains momentum as the Moonlight Sect’s banner waves across the land. The people rally behind their cause, driving the Dark Elves into retreat. However, on the delta plains, the forces of the Decadent Heart lie in wait, preparing to enslave the rebels. It’s time for the Decadent Heart to tighten its net.
Set Sail
The Decadent Heart sees the rebels as easy prey, but they will soon learn that Cathay’s people cannot be crushed.
A Disaster Waiting to Happen
The peasants are not ready to face the Decadent Heart. This will be a slaughter.

[[col:red]]The rebels face the Decadent Heart’s forces in the delta plains.[[/col]]\\n\\nYou will participate in the battle from the perspective of a peasant army. Victory will grant you command of this regiment as a reward.
Battle of the Tomb of Warriors

As loyalists shift more forces north to suppress the rebellion of Nan Yang, Han Cheng’s forces are stretched thin. Rumors of dissent spread among his followers. The King of Nan Yang desperately needs a decisive victory to stabilize morale.\\n\\nThe artisans of Phantom City have constructed Cathay’s most massive fleet, and it now sails westward. Han Cheng has learned of Miao Ying’s movements and has set his sights on her fleet resting at the Tomb of Warriors. He has staked everything on this battle. Defeating the Storm Dragon’s forces here may turn the tide of war.
Blade Meets Blade
A Duel of Sky Junks
Flames Consume the Sky
Masts Reduced to Ash...

[[col:red]]The Tempest Dragon and the King of Nan Yang will clash at the Tomb of Warriors in a decisive naval battle.[[/col]]\\n\\nYou will participate in the battle from the perspective of a Longma cavalry regiment. Victory will grant you command of this unit as a reward.
Our strength lies not in weapons but in righteousness.
Mandated by the People
In a breath, the masts are reduced to ash.
Longma Rides the Skies
You bear witness to a battle that will be sung of for millennia.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]"Be the wall that protects the land."[[/col]]
The wheels roll forward...
End of the Battle of Longmen Gate
You bear witness to a battle that will be sung of for millennia.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]"Our strength lies not in weapons but in righteousness."[[/col]]
The wheels roll forward...
End of the Battle of the Jade Delta
You bear witness to a battle that will be sung of for millennia.\\n\\n[[col:yellow]]"In a breath, the masts are reduced to ash."[[/col]]
